name: Sazerac
about: The Sazerac is one of America's oldest cocktails, originating in New Orleans in the 1850s. It was originally made with cognac, but rye whiskey became the standard spirit after the phylloxera epidemic devastated French vineyards.
instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice
Add rye whiskey, sugar, and both Peychaud's and Angostura bitters
Rinse the chilled glass with absinthe, discarding excess
Strain the cocktail into the absinthe-rinsed glass
Express lemon peel over the surface and discard peel
notes: The Sazerac is traditionally served without ice in an absinthe-rinsed glass. The combination of Peychaud's bitters and absinthe gives it its distinctive flavor profile.
